did.abstract: Richard Ebihara, Wayland Quintero and Perry Yung started the Slant Performance Group in 1995, in order to address Asian racial and sexual stereotypes. Their first show, Big Dicks Asian Men, examined Asian masculinity. As a trio, the group created nine original theatrical productions and toured across America over a ten-year period. The Slant Performance Group Records (1995-2004) consist of performance materials created by the group. Materials include play scripts, photographs, press, brochures and pamphlets, notebooks, a mailing list, and video recordings.
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Slant Performance Group Records (1995-2004) consist of performance materials created by the group. Materials include play scripts, photographs, press, brochures and pamphlets, notebooks, a mailing list, and video recordings. These materials reflect the experimental, musical theater performed by the group and focus on the racial issues faced by Asian American men.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Richard Ebihara, Wayland Quintero and Perry Yung started the Slant Performance Group in 1995, in order to address Asian racial and sexual stereotypes. Their first show, Big Dicks Asian Men, examined Asian masculinity. As a trio, the group created nine original theatrical productions and toured across America over a ten-year period.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by the Slant Performance Group, March 4, 2025. The accession number associated with this gift is 2025.006.

phystech.head: Audiovisual Access Policies and Procedures
phystech.p: Audiovisual materials have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers. Materials not yet digitized will need to have access copies made before they can be used. To request an access copy, or if you are unsure if an item has been digitized, please contact Fales Library and Special Collections, special.collections@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596, with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Slant Performance Group Records; MSS 653; box number; folder number or item identifier; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Materials were placed in new acid-free folders and boxes. Some materials were removed from binders.
Two DVDs and 1 CD were deaccessioned; the DVDs were duplicates of the performance on video8 in the collection and the CD was a commercial recording.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Prior to their donation, materials were created and kept by the individual members of the group, and stored in their homes. Materials were ultimately hand-delivered to Laura Chen-Schultz at the offices of the Asian/Pacific/American Institute at NYU, where they were held as of 2024.
